intro: Colymbada carduiformis, commonly known as the carduetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a cluster of small flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are usually lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive shape. Colymbada carduiformis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
